node.title: Julia Gillard among international flight passengers into Adelaide sent to hotel quarantine after Omicron concern
node.alt: A close up screen grab from a Zoom link of Julia Gillard.
node.description: Former prime minister Julia Gillard is one of many overseas arrivals sent to hotel quarantine in Adelaide despite having prior approval to isolate at home.
node.content:
["Former prime minister Julia Gillard was one of many overseas arrivals sent to hotel quarantine in Adelaide despite having prior approval to isolate at home.", "Ms GIllard has\u00a0now been released after returning a negative test result but others have not\u00a0been so fortunate, with one passenger stuck in a medi-hotel confused as to why his home quarantine approval landed him there.", "The ABC has spoken to other passengers who have found themselves in the same situation.", "Professional golfer Wade Ormsby has also been caught up on returning from Singapore.", "Concerns about the Omicron variant has seen SA Health double the length of quarantine for all international arrivals to 14 days\u00a0late last month, and also bolster testing requirements for interstate travellers this week.", "Previously, people had been allowed to quarantine at home using the Home Quarantine SA app\u00a0so it is unclear why passengers on these recent flights have been put into hotel quarantine.\u00a0", "
Passengers 'cut adrift'
", "Dan Coward had been to the UK for his mother's funeral and decided to bring his return flight forward after the Omicron variant emerged.", "He completed all his necessary testing and pre-approval paperwork before arriving in SA via Doha on the same flight as Ms Gillard.", "He is fully vaccinated and was prepared to quarantine at home \u2014 but that quickly changed.", "\"There was an announcement on the plane that we would all be going to 14 days of quarantine, which felt a bit odd,\" Mr Coward said from the Peppers medi-hotel in Adelaide.", "", "
Dan Coward, who is in hotel quarantine in Adelaide after an international flight.(Supplied)
", "\"Then we queued up at the passport control and it was at that point that we were told by someone officially that we were going straight to hotel quarantine, which was\u00a0definitely confusing for a lot of people who were approved for home quarantine.", "\"It was disappointing and it was a bit confusing.\"", "He said the most official communication he had received since arriving at the hotel was from his home quarantine app, which he had initiated in anticipation of being at home.", "\"They rang me to ask why I wasn't at the location I had provided and I explained that I was in hotel quarantine, which was a surprise to them,\" he said.", "\"I just got another text from them asking them why I had missed my test date today and that was because I have done one here in hotel quarantine and I'm not able to go to a test centre and upload those results.\"", "", "
The Peppers Waymouth Hotel\u00a0in Adelaide's CBD.(ABC News: Brant Cumming)
", "Mr Coward said a nurse at the hotel had told him that there \"had been a mistake at the airport\" and those who were approved was supposed to be allowed to quarantine at home.", "He had hoped after returning a negative test result on his first night in hotel quarantine that his time there would be short-lived but he remained confined to his room.", "\"It does feel like we've all been sort of cut adrift,\" he said.", "\"The word chaos has been used when I've been on the phone to people at the other end. Clearly it's not the fault of the nurses downstairs, they're doing their best in the situation but \u2026 the solution from here is still obviously very unclear.\"", "SA Health has been contacted for comment.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
